Description: A complete dark brown, woven mat made of human hair. The weave is plain, half-basket and fairly open. The hair yarns are 's'-spun. One selvedge is reinforced with two paired warps. The other selvedge is plain with two paired warps. Both edges are finished with 's'-twisted warp cords. The warp thread count is 4 per 10mm. The weft is used in pairs and its thread count is 5 pairs per 10mm. A coarse darn 130 x 100mm is located in the centre of the mat. It measures 130x100mm and is made of mixed light and dark fibres, possibly goat hair and/or human hair. The thread is 's'-spun coarse hair.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.64-65, pl. 15C, D)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.225c (excavation object cat. no.)
